contentList.content: Amplify

Take necrotic damage equal to your hemocraft die and gain additional benefits depending on the Blood Curse.

Amplifying a Blood Curse allows you to affect creatures which don't have blood.
Bloodless
Bloodless creatures are creatures without blood: Undead, Constructs, Elementals, Plants, and Oozes.
Blood Hunter
Clever warriors determined to protect the realms from evils old and new. Blood magic, secretive rites, and self-sacrifice aid them against the monsters they hunt.
Order of the Lycan
Become a monster to fight monsters. Members of this order embrace Lycanthropy, taming the beast with Blood magic. However, even the most vigilant can be lost to their hunger.
Order of the Ghostslayer

Oldest of the Blood Hunter orders, its members have rediscovered the secrets of hemocraft and refined them for combat against the scourge of undeath. Destroy the scourge wherever it is found, tune your abilities to engage undead creatures, and those who manipulate the necromancy that creates them.

Brand of Castigation

Channel hemocraft magic to sear an arcane brand into that creature you damage with a Crimson Rite. Each time the branded creature deals damage to you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you, the branded creature takes [1]. The brand lasts until you complete a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Branded creature creature takes [1] damage each time they attack the Blood Hunter that branded them, or anyone within 5ft of the Hunter.

You gain an additional use of your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="PassiveBloodMaledict_Tooltip">Blood Maledict</LSTag> feature. In addition, your blood curses can target any creature, whether it has blood or not.
Aether Walk

For a number of rounds equal to your spellcasting modifier ([1]), magically step into the veil between planes. Your appearance becomes misty, and you can pass through creatures and walls using Aether Step.
Character has stepped into the veil between planes and can pass through creatures and walls.
Aether Step
Walk between the veil and pass through creatures and walls.
Brand of Sundering

Channel hemocraft magic to sear an arcane brand into that creature you damage with a Crimson Rite. Each time the branded creature deals damage to you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you, the branded creature takes [1]. The brand lasts until you complete a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. In addition, whenever you damage a creature with a Crimson Rite, roll an additional Hemocraft Die. Branded creatures cannot become invisible.

Branded creature creature takes [1] damage each time they attack the Blood Hunter that branded them, or anyone within 5ft of the Hunter. In addition, creature takes extra damage from Crimson Rites and cannot become invisible.
Heightened Senses
You gain the improved senses of a natural predator. You have advantage on <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> (Perception) checks.
Hybrid Form

Transform into a special hybrid form until you dismiss the form as a bonus action, one hour passes, or you finish a Long Rest and gain the following features and drawbacks:

Feral Might
Resilient Hide
Predatory Strikes
Bloodlust
Dismiss Hybrid Form
Revert to your original form.
Hybrid: Feral Might

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> checks and <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> saving throws. Additionally give a +[1] bonus to melee damage rolls.
Hybrid: Improved Feral Might

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> checks and <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> saving throws. Additionally give a +[2] bonus to melee damage rolls.
Hybrid: Feral Might Upgrade
Your unarmed strikes now have a +[1] bonus to melee damage rolls.
Hybrid: Resilient Hide

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. Additionally, while you are not wearing heavy armor, you have a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armor Class</LSTag>.
Hybrid: Predatory Strikes

You can apply your Crimson Rite feature to your unarmed strikes, which you treat as one weapon. You can use <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes, which deal [1]. Additionally, when you use the Attack action to make an unarmed strike, you can make one additional unarmed strike as a bonus action.
Slashing Predatory Strikes
Bludgeoning Predatory Strikes
Hybrid: Predatory Strikes Upgrade
While in Hybrid form, your unarmed strikes now deal [1] slashing damage. Additionally, your predatory strikes are considered magical if you have a Predatory Crimson Rite active.
Hybrid: Bloodlust

If you start your turn with fewer hit points than half your hit point maximum, you must succeed on a DC 8 Wisdom saving throw or move directly toward the nearest creature and use the Attack action against that creature. Once your attack is resolved, you regain control of yourself.
Bloodlust
Creature is temporarily blinded by their bestial hunger and will attack the nearest creature.
Hybrid: Stalker's Prowess
Your speed increases by 15 feet, and your jumping distance is doubled.
Hybrid: Advanced Transformation
You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
Hybrid: Lycan Regeneration

At the start of each of your turns, when you have at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half your hit point maximum, you gain hit points equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier ([1]). If you are in hybrid form, you gain these hit points before you must make the saving throw for your bloodlust.
Lycan Regeneration
Your lycan form grants you supernatural regeneration.
Predatory Strikes Bonus Attack
Make an additional predatory strike.
Predatory Strikes: Rite of the Frozen
Predatory Strikes: Rite of the Flame

As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, imbue your unarmed strikes to deal extra damage equal to one roll of your Hemocraft die for your chosen damage type. On activating the rite, you take one roll of your Hemocraft die in necrotic damage. Rite damage is magical and lasts until you dismiss it, or complete a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Blood Curses

Channel a part of your vital essence to curse and manipulate creatures through hemocraft magic. By paying a price of your own vitality, you can choose to amplify the curse for additional boons. Creatures that do not have blood are immune to blood curses unless you have amplified the curse.
Crimson Rites

Sacrifice your vitality to invoke a rite of hemocraft that infuses your weapon strikes with elemental energy. Attacks you make with a rite infused weapon are magical, and deal extra damage equal to your hemocraft die of the type determined by the chosen rite. A weapon can hold only one active rite at a time, and other creatures can’t gain the benefit of your rite.
Blood Hunter Longsword
A sword typically associated with Blood Hunters, longer than a Rapier but lighter than a Longsword.
Blood Hunter Studded Leather
Armor easily identifiable as belonging to a Blood Hunter. Light, efficient, and styled to work best in the night.
